parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The identifier of this element used to reference it in other components

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: consumerKey
parameter.description: The OAuth consumerKey as registered with the service provider

parameter.name: consumerSecret
parameter.description: The OAuth consumerSecret as registered with the service provider

parameter.name: authorizationUrl
parameter.description: The service provider's authorization endpoint URL

parameter.name: accessTokenUrl
parameter.description: The service provider's accessToken endpoint URL

parameter.name: scopes
parameter.description: The OAuth scopes to be requested during the dance. If not provided, it will default to those in the annotation

parameter.name: resourceOwnerId
parameter.description: The resourceOwnerId which each component should use if it doesn't reference otherwise.

parameter.name: before
parameter.description: The name of a flow to be executed right before starting the OAuth dance

parameter.name: after
parameter.description: The name of a flow to be executed right after an accessToken has been received

parameter.name: listenerConfig
parameter.description: A reference to a <http:listener-config /> to be used in order to create the listener that will catch the access token callback endpoint.

parameter.name: callbackPath
parameter.description: The path of the access token callback endpoint

parameter.name: authorizePath
parameter.description: The path of the local http endpoint which triggers the OAuth dance

parameter.name: externalCallbackUrl
parameter.description: If the callback endpoint is behind a proxy or should be accessed through a non direct URL, use this parameter to tell the OAuth provider the URL it should use to access the callback

parameter.name: objectStore
parameter.description: A reference to the object store that should be used to store each resource owner id's data. If not specified, runtime will automatically provision the default one.

operation.name: createDraft
operation.description: Creates a new draft with the `DRAFT` label. This operation makes an HTTP POST request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/drafts endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: The user's email address. The special value `me` can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: createDraftBody
parameter.description: the content to use

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: gmailusersdraftslist
operation.description: Lists the drafts in the user's mailbox. This operation makes an HTTP GET request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/drafts endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: The user's email address. The special value `me` can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: maxResultsQueryParam
parameter.description: Maximum number of drafts to return.

parameter.name: pageTokenQueryParam
parameter.description: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

parameter.name: qQueryParam
parameter.description: Only return draft messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, `"from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread"`.

parameter.name: includeSpamTrashQueryParam
parameter.description: Include drafts from `SPAM` and `TRASH` in the results.

operation.name: gmailusershistorylist
operation.description: Lists the history of all changes to the given mailbox. History results are returned in chronological order (increasing `historyId`). This operation makes an HTTP GET request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/history endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: The user's email address. The special value `me` can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: maxResultsQueryParam
parameter.description: The maximum number of history records to return.

parameter.name: pageTokenQueryParam
parameter.description: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

parameter.name: startHistoryIdQueryParam
parameter.description: Required. Returns history records after the specified `startHistoryId`. The supplied `startHistoryId` should be obtained from the `historyId` of a message, thread, or previous `list` response. History IDs increase chronologically but are not contiguous with random gaps in between valid IDs. Supplying an invalid or out of date `startHistoryId` typically returns an `HTTP 404` error code. A `historyId` is typically valid for at least a week, but in some rare circumstances may be valid for only a few hours. If you receive an `HTTP 404` error response, your application should perform a full sync. If you receive no `nextPageToken` in the response, there are no updates to retrieve and you can store the returned `historyId` for a future request.

parameter.name: labelIdQueryParam
parameter.description: Only return messages with a label matching the ID.

parameter.name: historyTypesQueryParams
parameter.description: History types to be returned by the function

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.description: The ID of the message to retrieve. This ID is usually retrieved using `messages.list`. The ID is also contained in the result when a message is inserted (`messages.insert`) or imported (`messages.import`).

parameter.description: The format to return the message in.

parameter.description: When given and format is `METADATA`, only include headers specified.

operation.name: gmailusersmessagesimport
operation.description: Imports a message into only this user's mailbox, with standard email delivery scanning and classification similar to receiving via SMTP. Does not send a message. Note: This function doesn't trigger forwarding rules or filters set up by the user. This operation makes an HTTP POST request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/messages/import endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: The user's email address. The special value `me` can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: internalDateSourceQueryParam
parameter.description: Source for Gmail's internal date of the message.

parameter.name: neverMarkSpamQueryParam
parameter.description: Ignore the Gmail spam classifier decision and never mark this email as SPAM in the mailbox.

parameter.name: processForCalendarQueryParam
parameter.description: Process calendar invites in the email and add any extracted meetings to the Google Calendar for this user.

parameter.name: deletedQueryParam
parameter.description: Mark the email as permanently deleted (not TRASH) and only visible in Google Vault to a Vault administrator. Only used for G Suite accounts.

parameter.name: gmailusersmessagesimportBody
parameter.description: the content to use

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: gmailusersmessagesinsert
operation.description: Directly inserts a message into only this user's mailbox similar to `IMAP APPEND`, bypassing most scanning and classification. Does not send a message. This operation makes an HTTP POST request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/messages endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: The user's email address. The special value `me` can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: internalDateSourceQueryParam
parameter.description: Source for Gmail's internal date of the message.

parameter.name: deletedQueryParam
parameter.description: Mark the email as permanently deleted (not TRASH) and only visible in Google Vault to a Vault administrator. Only used for G Suite accounts.

parameter.name: gmailusersmessagesinsertBody
parameter.description: the content to use

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.description: Lists the messages in the user's mailbox. This operation makes an HTTP GET request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/messages endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: The user's email address. The special value `me` can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: labelIdsQueryParams
parameter.description: Only return messages with labels that match all of the specified label IDs.

parameter.name: maxResultsQueryParam
parameter.description: Maximum number of messages to return.

parameter.name: pageTokenQueryParam
parameter.description: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

parameter.name: qQueryParam
parameter.description: Only return messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, `"from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread"`. Parameter cannot be used when accessing the api using the gmail.metadata scope.

parameter.name: includeSpamTrashQueryParam

operation.name: gmailuserssettingsdelegatescreate
operation.description: Adds a delegate with its verification status set directly to `accepted`, without sending any verification email. The delegate user must be a member of the same G Suite organization as the delegator user. Gmail imposes limitations on the number of delegates and delegators each user in a G Suite organization can have. These limits depend on your organization, but in general each user can have up to 25 delegates and up to 10 delegators. Note that a delegate user must be referred to by their primary email address, and not an email alias. Also note that when a new delegate is created, there may be up to a one minute delay before the new delegate is available for use. This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority. This operation makes an HTTP POST request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/settings/delegates endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: gmailuserssettingsdelegatescreateBody
parameter.description: the content to use

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: gmailuserssettingsdelegatesdelete
operation.description: Removes the specified delegate (which can be of any verification status), and revokes any verification that may have been required for using it. Note that a delegate user must be referred to by their primary email address, and not an email alias. This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority. This operation makes an HTTP DELETE request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/settings/delegates/{delegateEmail} endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: delegateEmailUriParam
parameter.description: The email address of the user to be removed as a delegate.

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: gmailuserssettingsdelegatesget
operation.description: Gets the specified delegate. Note that a delegate user must be referred to by their primary email address, and not an email alias. This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority. This operation makes an HTTP GET request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/settings/delegates/{delegateEmail} endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: delegateEmailUriParam
parameter.description: The email address of the user whose delegate relationship is to be retrieved.

operation.name: gmailuserssettingsforwardingAddressescreate
operation.description: Creates a forwarding address. If ownership verification is required, a message will be sent to the recipient and the resource's verification status will be set to `pending`; otherwise, the resource will be created with verification status set to `accepted`. This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority. This operation makes an HTTP POST request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/settings/forwardingAddresses endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

operation.name: gmailuserssettingssendAscreate
operation.description: Creates a custom "from" send-as alias. If an SMTP MSA is specified, Gmail will attempt to connect to the SMTP service to validate the configuration before creating the alias. If ownership verification is required for the alias, a message will be sent to the email address and the resource's verification status will be set to `pending`; otherwise, the resource will be created with verification status set to `accepted`. If a signature is provided, Gmail will sanitize the HTML before saving it with the alias. This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority. This operation makes an HTTP POST request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/settings/sendAs endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: gmailuserssettingssendAscreateBody
parameter.description: the content to use

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.description: Updates a send-as alias. If a signature is provided, Gmail will sanitize the HTML before saving it with the alias. operation.name: gmailuserssettingsupdateAutoForwarding
operation.description: Updates the auto-forwarding setting for the specified account. A verified forwarding address must be specified when auto-forwarding is enabled. This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority. This operation makes an HTTP PUT request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/settings/autoForwarding endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam

operation.name: gmailuserssettingsupdateLanguage
operation.description: Updates language settings. If successful, the return object contains the `displayLanguage` that was saved for the user, which may differ from the value passed into the request. This is because the requested `displayLanguage` may not be directly supported by Gmail but have a close variant that is, and so the variant may be chosen and saved instead. This operation makes an HTTP PUT request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/settings/language endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: gmailuserssettingsupdateLanguageBody

operation.name: gmailusersthreadslist
operation.description: Lists the threads in the user's mailbox. This operation makes an HTTP GET request to the /gmail/v1/users/{userId}/threads endpoint

parameter.name: userIdUriParam
parameter.description: The user's email address. The special value `me` can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameter.name: labelIdsQueryParams
parameter.description: Only return threads with labels that match all of the specified label IDs.

parameter.name: maxResultsQueryParam
parameter.description: Maximum number of threads to return.

parameter.name: pageTokenQueryParam
parameter.description: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

parameter.name: qQueryParam
parameter.description: Only return threads matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, `"from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread"`. Parameter cannot be used when accessing the api using the gmail.metadata scope.

parameter.name: includeSpamTrashQueryParam
parameter.description: Include threads from `SPAM` and `TRASH` in the results.

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: unauthorize
operation.description: Deletes all the access token information of a given resource owner id so that it's impossible to execute any operation for that user without doing the authorization dance again
